com.OODPAssn1.Managers

Class DataManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.OODPAssn1.Managers.DataManager
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    CourseManager, UserManager

    public class DataManager
extends java.lang.Object
    DataManager is a base class for any classes that wants to handle and manipulate data stored in a .dat file
    It stores and reads Serializable objects

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private static java.lang.String cFilePath

      Constructor and Description
      DataManager(java.lang.String filename)
      Initialises the DataManager object which creates a "database" folder in the root directory of the application.

      Initialises the DataManager object which creates a "database" folder in the root directory of the application.

    • Field Detail

      • cFilePath

        private static final java.lang.String cFilePath

    • Constructor Detail

      • DataManager

        public DataManager(java.lang.String filename)
        Initialises the DataManager object which creates a "database" folder in the root directory of the application.
        In addition, a database file is created in that folder based on the String passed into the constructor.
        Parameters:
        filename - The filename e.g. user.dat

      • DataManager

        public DataManager(java.lang.String filepath1,
                   java.lang.String filepath2)
        Initialises the DataManager object which creates a "database" folder in the root directory of the application.
        In addition, a two database files isare created in that folder based on the Strings passed into the constructor.
        Parameters:
        filepath1 - first filename
        filepath2 - second filename

    • Method Detail

      • read

        protected java.lang.Object read(java.lang.String filename)
        Parameters:
        filename - filename to open and load the Serializable objects from
        Returns:
        Serializable objects. Objects should be downcasted into the correct derived objects and stored into an ArrayList

      • write

        protected boolean write(java.util.List list,
                        java.lang.String filename)
        Parameters:
        list - List of objects to write into the database file
        filename - name of the database file
        Returns:
        true if successful

      • write

        protected boolean write(AccessPeriod aP,
                        java.lang.String filename)
        Parameters:
        aP - the AccessPeriod object to write into the database file
        filename - name of the database file
        Returns:
        true if successful
